thread.title: Hillary Clinton on whether she would consider VP position: Hypothetically, no
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton on whether she would consider VP position: Hypothetically, no - POLITICO

author: Nick Gass
title: Hillary Clinton on whether she would consider VP position: Hypothetically, no
text:
Hillary Clinton wryly rejected the notion of considering the No. 2 spot on a presidential ticket on Monday, remarking in an answer to a hypothetical question that she hypothetically would not go for VP. During a town hall event broadcast on NBC's "Today," Carson Daly read a question from a Facebook user asking Clinton if she would "hypothetically speaking" consider taking the vice president position.
"It says hypothetically speaking, would you consider a vice president position," host Savannah Guthrie repeated to Clinton, who laughed.
â€œHypothetically speaking, no," she said, to applause.
Asked if she would consider a woman as her running mate, Clinton said she would "consider the qualified people of whom we have, thankfully, in large number in the Democratic Party, because the most important choice is if something happens to the president, do you have full confidence that that person will step right in and do a great job for the country."
"That's the most important thing to me, and it doesn't matter who that person is, if that's what I believe about him or her," she added.
